Attack = Motive (Goal) + Method (TTPs) + Vulnerability

Selected Answer: B

The answer should be B, an attack is a combination of a goal, method, and a vulnerable system.

questions.question_text: Kelly is taking backups of the organization's data. Currently, she is taking backups of only those files that are created or modified after the last backup. What type of backup is Kelly using?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
it should be B, according to CND book page 1312 "Incremental backup: Backs up only the data that has changed since the last backup"

Selected Answer: B
Incremental: Only backup files that have been changed or created after the last backup are copied to the backup media. Page 1312 CND book

Selected Answer: B
An Incremental backup strategy involves taking backups of only those files that are created or modified after the last backup, regardless of whether the previous backup was a full, incremental or differential backup. In this strategy, only the changes made to the files since the last backup are backed up, which reduces the backup time and storage requirements.

questions.question_text: Identify the virtualization level that creates a massive pool of storage areas for different virtual machines running on the hardware.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A, According to the CND book, page 1394. Fabric virtualization is the level of virtualization that creates a massive pool of storage areas for different virtual machines.
